title: Rising Temperature
markdown:
# **Rising Temperature**

**Difficulty:** Medium  •  **Tags:** `SELF JOIN` • `DATE`



## **Problem Description**

Find all dates' IDs where the temperature was higher than the previous day.



## **Table Schema**

**weather**
```
+-------------+------+
| Column      | Type |
+-------------+------+
| id          | INT  |
| record_date | DATE |
| temperature | INT  |
+-------------+------+
```



## **Example**

### **Input**

**weather**
```
+----+-------------+-------------+
| id | record_date | temperature |
+----+-------------+-------------+
| 1  | 2023-01-01  | 10          |
| 2  | 2023-01-02  | 25          |
| 3  | 2023-01-03  | 20          |
| 4  | 2023-01-04  | 30          |
+----+-------------+-------------+
```

### **Expected Output**

```
+----+
| id |
+----+
| 2  |
| 4  |
+----+
```

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE weather(id INT, record_date DATE, temperature INT); INSERT INTO weather VALUES (1,'2023-01-01',10),(2,'2023-01-02',25),(3,'2023-01-03',20),(4,'2023-01-04',30);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT w1.id FROM weather w1 JOIN weather w2 ON julianday(w1.record_date) - julianday(w2.record_date) = 1 WHERE w1.temperature > w2.temperature;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE weather(id INT, record_date DATE, temperature INT);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT w1.id FROM weather w1 JOIN weather w2 ON julianday(w1.record_date) - julianday(w2.record_date) = 1 WHERE w1.temperature > w2.temperature;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE weather(id INT, record_date DATE, temperature INT); INSERT INTO weather VALUES (1,'2023-01-01',10),(2,'2023-01-02',25),(3,'2023-01-03',20),(4,'2023-01-04',30);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT w1.id FROM weather w1 JOIN weather w2 ON julianday(w1.record_date) - julianday(w2.record_date) = 1 WHERE w1.temperature > w2.temperature;
